summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 31 to November 1, 2019, primarily between attorneys discussing scheduling a call and a significant underlying issue regarding defendant Nicholas Tartaglione's access to discovery materials while incarcerated. Bruce Barket, Tartaglione's attorney, raises concerns that his client has been denied access to discovery since October 18.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas 'Nick' Tartaglione. He is the primary correspondent raising the alarm that his client has been denied access to discovery materials while in custody.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Referred to as 'Nick' and 'Tartaglione'. He is the incarcerated individual whose access to legal discovery materials is the central issue of the correspondence.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the legal representative advocating for Nicholas Tartaglione's access to discovery materials while Tartaglione is incarcerated.

events.title: Discovery Taken from Tartaglione
events.description: The date when Nicholas Tartaglione's discovery materials were reportedly taken from him while he was incarcerated.

events.title: Email Chain Regarding Discovery Access
events.description: Bruce Barket emails a supervisory staff attorney to report that his client, Nicholas Tartaglione, has not been permitted to view his discovery since October 18, despite prior arrangements.

events.title: Scheduling Call About Discovery Issue
events.description: Attorneys schedule a call for 11:00 AM to discuss the ongoing problem with Tartaglione's access to discovery.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Bruce Barket, attorney for Nicholas Tartaglione, reports that his client has been denied access to his discovery materials since they were taken from him on October 18, 2019.
The correspondence indicates prior arrangements were made for Tartaglione to view discovery in an attorney conference room on a weekend, but a new problem had arisen.
The email chain involves scheduling a call between an Assistant United States Attorney and a Supervisory Staff Attorney at the Metropolitan Correctional Center to address the access issue.
The document reveals procedural concerns regarding a defendant's right to access legal materials while in federal custody.
